About the artwork:

This vibrant mixed-media piece bursts with symbolic flowers, confronting class divides and power dynamics through riotous contrasts, demanding a reexamination of hope amid despair in Pétion’s signature blend of first- and third-world imagery.

About the artist:

Jean-Guerly Pétion uses symbols and imageries suggesting extremes of differences, with paintings confronting first- and third-world class issues via theoretical texts and power depictions in assemblage and mixed-media. His work demands new readings of gods and commoners, hope and despair, faith and mistrust.

Pétion was born in Haiti and lives and works in Los Angeles, California. He holds a BFA from the Kansas City Art Institute and an MFA from CalArts.
